domino.java

Interface ServiceWatching

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    OsgiContext

    public interface ServiceWatching

    Provides convenient methods to add a service watcher to the current scope or wait until services are present.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

    • Method Detail

      • watchAdvancedServices

        <S> org.osgi.util.tracker.ServiceTracker<S,S> watchAdvancedServices(Class<S> type,
                                                                    String filter,
                                                                    de.tototec.utils.functional.Procedure1<ServiceWatcherEvent<S>> f)

        Lets you react to service events for services with the specified type which match the given filter.

        Parameters:
        type - The Class representing the service type.
        filer - A filter criteria expression (LDAP-style filter) to further specify the service, or null.
        f - Service event handler
        Returns:
        Underlying service tracker

      • whenAdvancedServicePresent

        <S> org.osgi.util.tracker.ServiceTracker<S,S> whenAdvancedServicePresent(Class<S> type,
                                                                         String filter,
                                                                         de.tototec.utils.functional.Procedure1<S> f)

        Activates the given inner logic as long as the first service of the given type is present. This implements the concept of required services. The inner logic is started as soon as a service s of the given type gets present and stopped when s is removed.

        Parameters:
        type - The Class representing the service type.
        filer - A filter criteria expression (LDAP-style filter) to further specify the service, or null.

      • whenServicePresent

        <S> org.osgi.util.tracker.ServiceTracker<S,S> whenServicePresent(Class<S> type,
                                                                 de.tototec.utils.functional.Procedure1<S> f)

        Waits until a service of the specified type is available and executes the given event handler with it. When the service disappears, the capsules added in the handlers are stopped. You can wait on a bunch of services if you nest whenServicePresent methods.

        Parameters:
        f - Handler
        Returns:
        Underlying service tracker

      • whenServicesPresent

        <S1,S2> org.osgi.util.tracker.ServiceTracker<S1,S1> whenServicesPresent(Class<S1> type1,
                                                                        Class<S2> type2,
                                                                        de.tototec.utils.functional.Procedure2<S1,S2> f)
